channel.title: Isue whith IP-adress!
channel.description:
How come this page: check.torproject
say my ip is coinfigure trough tor? And aperar som be: 185.220.102.7
and this one (below)say that my ip is a difrent one!? whatsmyip
This is some what bothering! I have tride turning of VPN on host as well.
also if i recall correctly the box where the ip adress shows up on "test pages" sould be emty when useing whoinix?

item.title: Isue whith IP-adress!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
WWW:

How come this page:
check.torproject

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Browser Tests - Whonix

check.torproject.org says "Sorry. You are not using Tor."? On false positives. And browser fingerprinting. How unique are you? On Browser Tests and Browser Security. Notes on sites such as ip-check.info and whoer.net.

WWW:

I have tride turning of VPN on host as well.

Cannot have any effect on that. See this page:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

WWW:

also if i recall correctly the box where the ip adress shows up on “test pages” sould be emty when useing whoinix?

No. It’s not possible to hide IP address in a sense that there is none. Whonix uses the Tor network. IPs are provided by Tor network.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#What_is_Tor.3F

Read full topic

item.title: Isue whith IP-adress!
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Yes, that makes sens. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Isue whith IP-adress!
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Tor stream isolation at work. Every domain you visit is done thru a separate exit IP.
